borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div>The bulk, mass, scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in a significantly overbearing impact to neighbouring properties especially no.144 Westrow Drive,&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 14px;">thus is considered to have an unacceptable impact</span><span style="color:#e74c3c"><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-size: 14px;">on the living conditions of neighbouring properties</span>,</span>&nbsp;contrary to:<br></div><div><span style="font-size: 10.5pt;"><br></span></div><ul><li><span style="font-size: 10.5pt;">Paragraph 130(f)&nbsp;</span><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023);</li><li><span style="font-size: 10.5pt;">Policy
D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li>Policy
CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Paragraph 5.3.3 of the Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</li></ul>

<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-size: 14px;">The proposed development (including the three storey rear/side extension, loft conversion and rear dormer), by reason of bulk, mass, scale, siting and design, would result in a disproportionately large dwewllinghouse with a top-heavy roofscape, by increasing the height of the ridge of the roof of the existing side extension, resulting in the loss of the appearance of a subordinate extension and further detracting from the original roof design, character of the dwelling and causing the&nbsp;loss of balance and symmetry within the terrace row</span>.</span>&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is detrimental to the character of the area and is contrary to:</div><div><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;"><br></span></div><ul><li><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">Paragraph 126 of the National Planning Policy Framework </span>&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023);</li><li>Policy D4 of the
London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policy
CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Paragraph 5.3.3 and 5.6.2 of the Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</li></ul>
description: Construction of a first floor rear extension and construction of a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front, one roof light to the side, a Juliette balcony and the addition of a window to the side elevation
